Setting.Name: SecureMode
Setting.Description: Disables the web installer (http://yourhost.example.com/otrs/installer.pl), to prevent the system from being hijacked. If not enabled, the system can be reinstalled and the current basic configuration will be used to pre-populate the questions within the installer script. If enabled, it also disables the GenericAgent, PackageManager and SQL Box.

Setting.Name: Frontend::DebugMode
Setting.Description: Enables or disables the debug mode over frontend interface.

Setting.Name: Frontend::AjaxDebug
Setting.Description: Delivers extended debugging information in the frontend in case any AJAX errors occur, if enabled.

Setting.Name: Frontend::TemplateCache
Setting.Description: Enables or disables the caching for templates. WARNING: Do NOT disable template caching for production environments for it will cause a massive performance drop! This setting should only be disabled for debugging reasons!

Setting.Name: ConfigLevel
Setting.Description: Sets the configuration level of the administrator. Depending on the config level, some sysconfig options will be not shown. The config levels are in in ascending order: Expert, Advanced, Beginner. The higher the config level is (e.g. Beginner is the highest), the less likely is it that the user can accidentally configure the system in a way that it is not usable any more.

Setting.Name: ConfigImportAllowed
Setting.Description: Controls if the admin is allowed to import a saved system configuration in SysConfig.

Setting.Name: ProductName
Setting.Description: Defines the name of the application, shown in the web interface, tabs and title bar of the web browser.

Setting.Name: SystemID
Setting.Description: Defines the system identifier. Every ticket number and http session string contains this ID. This ensures that only tickets which belong to your system will be processed as follow-ups (useful when communicating between two instances of OTRS).

Setting.Name: FQDN
Setting.Description: Defines the fully qualified domain name of the system. This setting is used as a variable, OTRS_CONFIG_FQDN which is found in all forms of messaging used by the application, to build links to the tickets within your system.

Setting.Name: SupportDataCollector::HTTPHostname
Setting.Description: Defines the HTTP hostname for the support data collection with the public module 'PublicSupportDataCollector' (e.g. used from the OTRS Daemon).

Setting.Name: SupportDataCollector::WebUserAgent::Timeout
Setting.Description: Defines the timeout (in seconds, minimum is 20 seconds) for the support data collection with the public module 'PublicSupportDataCollector' (e.g. used from the OTRS Daemon).

Setting.Name: HttpType
Setting.Description: Defines the type of protocol, used by the web server, to serve the application. If https protocol will be used instead of plain http, it must be specified here. Since this has no affect on the web server's settings or behavior, it will not change the method of access to the application and, if it is wrong, it will not prevent you from logging into the application. This setting is only used as a variable, OTRS_CONFIG_HttpType which is found in all forms of messaging used by the application, to build links to the tickets within your system.

Setting.Name: HTTPSForceRedirect
Setting.Description: Whether to force redirect all requests from http to https protocol. Please check that your web server is configured correctly for https protocol before enable this option.

Setting.Name: ScriptAlias
Setting.Description: Sets the prefix to the scripts folder on the server, as configured on the web server. This setting is used as a variable, OTRS_CONFIG_ScriptAlias which is found in all forms of messaging used by the application, to build links to the tickets within the system.

Setting.Name: AdminEmail
Setting.Description: Defines the system administrator's email address. It will be displayed in the error screens of the application.

Setting.Name: Organization
Setting.Description: Company name which will be included in outgoing emails as an X-Header.

Setting.Name: DefaultLanguage
Setting.Description: Defines the default front-end language. All the possible values are determined by the available language files on the system (see the next setting).

Setting.Name: DefaultUsedLanguages
Setting.Description: Defines all the languages that are available to the application. Specify only English names of languages here.

Setting.Name: DefaultUsedLanguagesNative
Setting.Description: Defines all the languages that are available to the application. Specify only native names of languages here.

Setting.Name: DefaultTheme
Setting.Description: Defines the default front-end (HTML) theme to be used by the agents and customers. If you like, you can add your own theme. Please refer the administrator manual located at https://doc.otrs.com/doc/.

Setting.Name: DefaultTheme::HostBased
Setting.Description: It is possible to configure different themes, for example to distinguish between agents and customers, to be used on a per-domain basis within the application. Using a regular expression (regex), you can configure a Key/Content pair to match a domain. The value in "Key" should match the domain, and the value in "Content" should be a valid theme on your system. Please see the example entries for the proper form of the regex.

Setting.Name: CustomerHeadline
Setting.Description: The headline shown in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: CustomerLogo
Setting.Description: The logo shown in the header of the customer interface. The URL to the image can be a relative URL to the skin image directory, or a full URL to a remote web server.

Setting.Name: AgentLogo
Setting.Description: The logo shown in the header of the agent interface. The URL to the image can be a relative URL to the skin image directory, or a full URL to a remote web server.

Setting.Name: AgentLogoCustom###default
Setting.Description: The logo shown in the header of the agent interface for the skin "default". See "AgentLogo" for further description.

Setting.Name: AgentLogoCustom###slim
Setting.Description: The logo shown in the header of the agent interface for the skin "slim". See "AgentLogo" for further description.

Setting.Name: AgentLogoCustom###ivory
Setting.Description: The logo shown in the header of the agent interface for the skin "ivory". See "AgentLogo" for further description.

Setting.Name: AgentLogoCustom###ivory-slim
Setting.Description: The logo shown in the header of the agent interface for the skin "ivory-slim". See "AgentLogo" for further description.

Setting.Name: AgentLogoCustom###highcontrast
Setting.Description: The logo shown in the header of the agent interface for the skin "High Contrast". See "AgentLogo" for further description.

Setting.Name: AgentLoginLogo
Setting.Description: The logo shown on top of the login box of the agent interface. The URL to the image can be a relative URL to the skin image directory, or a full URL to a remote web server.

Setting.Name: Frontend::WebPath
Setting.Description: Defines the URL base path of icons, CSS and Java Script.

Setting.Name: Frontend::ImagePath
Setting.Description: Defines the URL image path of icons for navigation.

Setting.Name: Frontend::CSSPath
Setting.Description: Defines the URL CSS path.

Setting.Name: Frontend::JavaScriptPath
Setting.Description: Defines the URL java script path.

Setting.Name: Frontend::RichText
Setting.Description: Uses richtext for viewing and editing: articles, salutations, signatures, standard templates, auto responses and notifications.

Setting.Name: Frontend::RichTextPath
Setting.Description: Defines the URL rich text editor path.

Setting.Name: Frontend::RichTextWidth
Setting.Description: Defines the width for the rich text editor component. Enter number (pixels) or percent value (relative).

Setting.Name: Frontend::RichTextHeight
Setting.Description: Defines the height for the rich text editor component. Enter number (pixels) or percent value (relative).

Setting.Name: Frontend::RichText::DefaultCSS
Setting.Description: Defines the default CSS used in rich text editors.

Setting.Name: Frontend::RichText::EnhancedMode
Setting.Description: Defines if the enhanced mode should be used (enables use of table, replace, subscript, superscript, paste from word, etc.).

Setting.Name: Frontend::RichText::EnhancedMode::Customer
Setting.Description: Defines if the enhanced mode should be used (enables use of table, replace, subscript, superscript, paste from word, etc.) in customer interface.

Setting.Name: DisableLoginAutocomplete
Setting.Description: Disable autocomplete in the login screen.

Setting.Name: DisableIFrameOriginRestricted
Setting.Description: Disable HTTP header "X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN" to allow OTRS to be included as an IFrame in other websites. Disabling this HTTP header can be a security issue! Only disable it, if you know what you are doing!

Setting.Name: DisableContentSecurityPolicy
Setting.Description: Disable HTTP header "Content-Security-Policy" to allow loading of external script contents. Disabling this HTTP header can be a security issue! Only disable it, if you know what you are doing!

Setting.Name: DefaultViewNewLine
Setting.Description: Automated line break in text messages after x number of chars.

Setting.Name: DefaultViewLines
Setting.Description: Sets the number of lines that are displayed in text messages (e.g. ticket lines in the QueueZoom).

Setting.Name: Frontend::MenuDragDropEnabled
Setting.Description: Turns on drag and drop for the main navigation.

Setting.Name: TimeInputFormat
Setting.Description: Defines the date input format used in forms (option or input fields).

Setting.Name: TimeInputMinutesStep
Setting.Description: Defines the available steps in time selections. Select "Minute" to be able to select all minutes of one hour from 1-59. Select "30 Minutes" to only make full and half hours available.

Setting.Name: TimeShowAlwaysLong
Setting.Description: Shows time in long format (days, hours, minutes), if enabled; or in short format (days, hours), if not enabled.

Setting.Name: AttachmentDownloadType
Setting.Description: Allows choosing between showing the attachments of a ticket in the browser (inline) or just make them downloadable (attachment).

Setting.Name: CheckMXRecord
Setting.Description: Makes the application check the MX record of email addresses before sending an email or submitting a telephone or email ticket.

Setting.Name: CheckMXRecord::Nameserver
Setting.Description: Defines the address of a dedicated DNS server, if necessary, for the "CheckMXRecord" look-ups.

Setting.Name: CheckEmailAddresses
Setting.Description: Makes the application check the syntax of email addresses.

Setting.Name: CheckEmailValidAddress
Setting.Description: Defines a regular expression that excludes some addresses from the syntax check (if "CheckEmailAddresses" is set to "Yes"). Please enter a regex in this field for email addresses, that aren't syntactically valid, but are necessary for the system (i.e. "root@localhost").

Setting.Name: CheckEmailInvalidAddress
Setting.Description: Defines a regular expression that filters all email addresses that should not be used in the application.

Setting.Name: LinkObject::ViewMode
Setting.Description: Determines the way the linked objects are displayed in each zoom mask.

Setting.Name: LinkObject::ShowDeleteButton
Setting.Description: Determines if a button to delete a link should be displayed next to each link in each zoom mask.

Setting.Name: LinkObject::Type###Normal
Setting.Description: Defines the link type 'Normal'. If the source name and the target name contain the same value, the resulting link is a non-directional one; otherwise, the result is a directional link.

Setting.Name: LinkObject::Type###ParentChild
Setting.Description: Defines the link type 'ParentChild'. If the source name and the target name contain the same value, the resulting link is a non-directional one; otherwise, the result is a directional link.

Setting.Name: LinkObject::TypeGroup###0001
Setting.Description: Defines the link type groups. The link types of the same group cancel one another. Example: If ticket A is linked per a 'Normal' link with ticket B, then these tickets could not be additionally linked with link of a 'ParentChild' relationship.

Setting.Name: LogModule
Setting.Description: Defines the log module for the system. "File" writes all messages in a given logfile, "SysLog" uses the syslog daemon of the system, e.g. syslogd.

Setting.Name: LogModule::SysLog::Facility
Setting.Description: If "SysLog" was selected for LogModule, a special log facility can be specified.

Setting.Name: LogModule::SysLog::Charset
Setting.Description: If "SysLog" was selected for LogModule, the charset that should be used for logging can be specified.

Setting.Name: LogModule::LogFile
Setting.Description: If "file" was selected for LogModule, a logfile must be specified. If the file doesn't exist, it will be created by the system.

Setting.Name: LogModule::LogFile::Date
Setting.Description: Adds a suffix with the actual year and month to the OTRS log file. A logfile for every month will be created.

Setting.Name: MinimumLogLevel
Setting.Description: Set the minimum log level. If you select 'error', just errors are logged. With 'debug' you get all logging messages. The order of log levels is: 'debug', 'info', 'notice' and 'error'.

Setting.Name: SendmailModule
Setting.Description: Defines the module to send emails. "DoNotSendEmail" doesn't send emails at all. Any of the "SMTP" mechanisms use a specified (external) mailserver. "Sendmail" directly uses the sendmail binary of your operating system. "Test" doesn't send emails, but writes them to $OTRS_HOME/var/tmp/CacheFileStorable/EmailTest/ for testing purposes.

Setting.Name: SendmailModule::CMD
Setting.Description: If "Sendmail" was selected as SendmailModule, the location of the sendmail binary and the needed options must be specified.

Setting.Name: SendmailModule::Host
Setting.Description: If any of the "SMTP" mechanisms was selected as SendmailModule, the mailhost that sends out the mails must be specified.

Setting.Name: SendmailModule::Port
Setting.Description: If any of the "SMTP" mechanisms was selected as SendmailModule, the port where your mailserver is listening for incoming connections must be specified.

Setting.Name: SendmailModule::AuthUser
Setting.Description: If any of the "SMTP" mechanisms was selected as SendmailModule, and authentication to the mail server is needed, an username must be specified.

Setting.Name: SendmailModule::AuthPassword
Setting.Description: If any of the "SMTP" mechanisms was selected as SendmailModule, and authentication to the mail server is needed, a password must be specified.

Setting.Name: SendmailBcc
Setting.Description: Sends all outgoing email via bcc to the specified address. Please use this only for backup reasons.

Setting.Name: SendmailEnvelopeFrom
Setting.Description: If set, this address is used as envelope sender in outgoing messages (not notifications - see below). If no address is specified, the envelope sender is equal to queue e-mail address.

Setting.Name: SendmailNotificationEnvelopeFrom
Setting.Description: If set, this address is used as envelope sender header in outgoing notifications. If no address is specified, the envelope sender header is empty (unless SendmailNotificationEnvelopeFrom::FallbackToEmailFrom is set).

Setting.Name: SendmailNotificationEnvelopeFrom::FallbackToEmailFrom
Setting.Description: If no SendmailNotificationEnvelopeFrom is specified, this setting makes it possible to use the email's from address instead of an empty envelope sender (required in certain mail server configurations).

Setting.Name: SendmailEncodingForce
Setting.Description: Forces encoding of outgoing emails (7bit|8bit|quoted-printable|base64).

Setting.Name: Sendmail::DefaultHeaders
Setting.Description: Defines default headers for outgoing emails.

Setting.Name: CommunicationLog::Transport###Email
Setting.Description: Registers a log module, that can be used to log communication related information.

Setting.Name: CommunicationLog::PurgeAfterHours::SuccessfulCommunications
Setting.Description: Defines the number of hours a successful communication will be stored.

Setting.Name: CommunicationLog::PurgeAfterHours::AllCommunications
Setting.Description: Defines the number of hours a communication will be stored, whichever its status.

Setting.Name: MailQueue
Setting.Description: MailQueue configuration settings.

Setting.Name: Frontend::AvatarEngine
Setting.Description: Define which avatar engine should be used for the agent avatar on the header and the sender images in AgentTicketZoom. If 'None' is selected, initials will be displayed instead. Please note that selecting anything other than 'None' will transfer the encrypted email address of the particular user to an external service.

Setting.Name: Frontend::Gravatar::DefaultImage
Setting.Description: Define which avatar default image should be used for the current agent if no gravatar is assigned to the mail address of the agent. Check https://gravatar.com/site/implement/images/ for further information.

Setting.Name: Frontend::Gravatar::ArticleDefaultImage
Setting.Description: Define which avatar default image should be used for the article view if no gravatar is assigned to the mail address. Check https://gravatar.com/site/implement/images/ for further information.

Setting.Name: LoginURL
Setting.Description: Defines an alternate URL, where the login link refers to.

Setting.Name: LogoutURL
Setting.Description: Defines an alternate URL, where the logout link refers to.

Setting.Name: PreApplicationModule###AgentInfo
Setting.Description: Defines a useful module to load specific user options or to display news.

Setting.Name: InfoKey
Setting.Description: Defines the key to be checked with Kernel::Modules::AgentInfo module. If this user preferences key is true, the message is accepted by the system.

Setting.Name: InfoFile
Setting.Description: File that is displayed in the Kernel::Modules::AgentInfo module, if located under Kernel/Output/HTML/Templates/Standard/AgentInfo.tt.

Setting.Name: Frontend::HeaderMetaModule###100-Refresh
Setting.Description: Defines the module to generate code for periodic page reloads.

Setting.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###1100-OTRSBusiness
Setting.Description: Defines the module to display a notification in different interfaces on different occasions for OTRS Business Solution™.

Setting.Name: CustomerFrontend::NotifyModule###1-OTRSBusiness
Setting.Description: Defines the module to display a notification in different interfaces on different occasions for OTRS Business Solution™.

Setting.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###2000-UID-Check
Setting.Description: Defines the module to display a notification in the agent interface, if the system is used by the admin user (normally you shouldn't work as admin).

Setting.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###2500-AgentSessionLimit
Setting.Description: Defines the module to display a notification in the agent interface, if the agent session limit prior warning is reached.

Setting.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###3000-ShowAgentOnline
Setting.Description: Defines the module that shows all the currently logged in agents in the agent interface.

Setting.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###4000-ShowCustomerOnline
Setting.Description: Defines the module that shows all the currently logged in customers in the agent interface.

Setting.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###5000-SystemConfigurationIsDirty-Check
Setting.Description: Defines the module to display a notification in the agent interface, if there are modified sysconfig settings that are not deployed yet.

Setting.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###5200-SystemConfigurationInvalid-Check
Setting.Description: Defines the module to display a notification in the agent interface, if there are invalid sysconfig settings deployed.

Setting.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###5500-OutofOffice-Check
Setting.Description: Defines the module to display a notification in the agent interface, if the agent is logged in while having out-of-office active.

Setting.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###6000-SystemMaintenance-Check
Setting.Description: Defines the module to display a notification in the agent interface, if the agent is logged in while having system maintenance active.

Setting.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###6050-SystemConfiguration-OutOfSync-Check
Setting.Description: Defines the module to display a notification in the agent interface if the system configuration is out of sync.

Setting.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###7000-AgentTimeZone-Check
Setting.Description: Defines the module to display a notification in the agent interface, if the agent has not yet selected a time zone.

Setting.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###8000-PackageManager-CheckNotVerifiedPackages
Setting.Description: Defines the module to display a notification in the agent interface, if the installation of not verified packages is activated (only shown to admins).

Setting.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###9000-Generic
Setting.Description: Defines the module that shows a generic notification in the agent interface. Either "Text" - if configured - or the contents of "File" will be displayed.

Setting.Name: SessionModule
Setting.Description: Defines the module used to store the session data. With "DB" the frontend server can be splitted from the db server. "FS" is faster.

Setting.Name: SessionName
Setting.Description: Defines the name of the session key. E.g. Session, SessionID or OTRS.

Setting.Name: CustomerPanelSessionName
Setting.Description: Defines the name of the key for customer sessions.

Setting.Name: SessionCheckRemoteIP
Setting.Description: Turns on the remote ip address check. It should not be enabled if the application is used, for example, via a proxy farm or a dialup connection, because the remote ip address is mostly different for the requests.

Setting.Name: SessionDeleteIfNotRemoteID
Setting.Description: Deletes a session if the session id is used with an invalid remote IP address.

Setting.Name: SessionMaxTime
Setting.Description: Defines the maximal valid time (in seconds) for a session id.

Setting.Name: SessionMaxIdleTime
Setting.Description: Sets the inactivity time (in seconds) to pass before a session is killed and a user is logged out.

Setting.Name: SessionDeleteIfTimeToOld
Setting.Description: Deletes requested sessions if they have timed out.

Setting.Name: SessionUseCookie
Setting.Description: Makes the session management use html cookies. If html cookies are disabled or if the client browser disabled html cookies, then the system will work as usual and append the session id to the links.

Setting.Name: SessionUseCookieAfterBrowserClose
Setting.Description: Stores cookies after the browser has been closed.

Setting.Name: SessionCSRFProtection
Setting.Description: Protection against CSRF (Cross Site Request Forgery) exploits (for more info see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-site_request_forgery).

Setting.Name: AgentSessionLimitPriorWarning
Setting.Description: Sets the maximum number of active agents within the timespan defined in SessionMaxIdleTime before a prior warning will be visible for the logged in agents.

Setting.Name: AgentSessionLimit
Setting.Description: Sets the maximum number of active agents within the timespan defined in SessionMaxIdleTime.

Setting.Name: AgentSessionPerUserLimit
Setting.Description: Sets the maximum number of active sessions per agent within the timespan defined in SessionMaxIdleTime.

Setting.Name: CustomerSessionLimit
Setting.Description: Sets the maximum number of active customers within the timespan defined in SessionMaxIdleTime.

Setting.Name: CustomerSessionPerUserLimit
Setting.Description: Sets the maximum number of active sessions per customers within the timespan defined in SessionMaxIdleTime.

Setting.Name: SessionDir
Setting.Description: If "FS" was selected for SessionModule, a directory where the session data will be stored must be specified.

Setting.Name: SessionTable
Setting.Description: If "DB" was selected for SessionModule, a table in database where session data will be stored must be specified.

Setting.Name: SessionAgentOnlineThreshold
Setting.Description: Defines the period of time (in minutes) before agent is marked as "away" due to inactivity (e.g. in the "Logged-In Users" widget or for the chat).

Setting.Name: SessionCustomerOnlineThreshold
Setting.Description: Defines the period of time (in minutes) before customer is marked as "away" due to inactivity (e.g. in the "Logged-In Users" widget or for the chat).

Setting.Name: TimeZone
Setting.Description: This setting is deprecated. Set OTRSTimeZone instead.

Setting.Name: OTRSTimeZone
Setting.Description: Sets the time zone being used internally by OTRS to e. g. store dates and times in the database. WARNING: This setting must not be changed once set and tickets or any other data containing date/time have been created.

Setting.Name: UserDefaultTimeZone
Setting.Description: Sets the time zone that will be assigned to newly created users and will be used for users that haven't yet set a time zone. This is the time zone being used as default to convert date and time between the OTRS time zone and the user's time zone.

Setting.Name: ShowUserTimeZoneSelectionNotification
Setting.Description: If enabled, users that haven't selected a time zone yet will be notified to do so. Note: Notification will not be shown if (1) user has not yet selected a time zone and (2) OTRSTimeZone and UserDefaultTimeZone do match and (3) are not set to UTC.

Setting.Name: MaximumCalendarNumber
Setting.Description: Maximum Number of a calendar shown in a dropdown.

Setting.Name: CalendarWeekDayStart
Setting.Description: Define the start day of the week for the date picker.

Setting.Name: TimeVacationDays
Setting.Description: Adds the permanent vacation days.

Setting.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime
Setting.Description: Adds the one time vacation days.

Setting.Name: TimeWorkingHours
Setting.Description: Defines the hours and week days to count the working time.

Setting.Name: TimeZone::Calendar1Name
Setting.Description: Defines the name of the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeZone::Calendar1
Setting.Description: Defines the time zone of the indicated calendar, which can be assigned later to a specific queue.

Setting.Name: CalendarWeekDayStart::Calendar1
Setting.Description: Define the start day of the week for the date picker for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar1
Setting.Description: Adds the permanent vacation days for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar1
Setting.Description: Adds the one time vacation days for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar1
Setting.Description: Defines the hours and week days of the indicated calendar, to count the working time.

Setting.Name: TimeZone::Calendar2Name
Setting.Description: Defines the name of the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeZone::Calendar2
Setting.Description: Defines the time zone of the indicated calendar, which can be assigned later to a specific queue.

Setting.Name: CalendarWeekDayStart::Calendar2
Setting.Description: Define the start day of the week for the date picker for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar2
Setting.Description: Adds the permanent vacation days for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar2
Setting.Description: Adds the one time vacation days for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar2
Setting.Description: Defines the hours and week days of the indicated calendar, to count the working time.

Setting.Name: TimeZone::Calendar3Name
Setting.Description: Defines the name of the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeZone::Calendar3
Setting.Description: Defines the time zone of the indicated calendar, which can be assigned later to a specific queue.

Setting.Name: CalendarWeekDayStart::Calendar3
Setting.Description: Define the start day of the week for the date picker for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar3
Setting.Description: Adds the permanent vacation days for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar3
Setting.Description: Adds the one time vacation days for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar3
Setting.Description: Defines the hours and week days of the indicated calendar, to count the working time.

Setting.Name: TimeZone::Calendar4Name
Setting.Description: Defines the name of the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeZone::Calendar4
Setting.Description: Defines the time zone of the indicated calendar, which can be assigned later to a specific queue.

Setting.Name: CalendarWeekDayStart::Calendar4
Setting.Description: Define the start day of the week for the date picker for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar4
Setting.Description: Adds the permanent vacation days for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar4
Setting.Description: Adds the one time vacation days for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar4
Setting.Description: Defines the hours and week days of the indicated calendar, to count the working time.

Setting.Name: TimeZone::Calendar5Name
Setting.Description: Defines the name of the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeZone::Calendar5
Setting.Description: Defines the time zone of the indicated calendar, which can be assigned later to a specific queue.

Setting.Name: CalendarWeekDayStart::Calendar5
Setting.Description: Define the start day of the week for the date picker for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar5
Setting.Description: Adds the permanent vacation days for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar5
Setting.Description: Adds the one time vacation days for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar5
Setting.Description: Defines the hours and week days of the indicated calendar, to count the working time.

Setting.Name: TimeZone::Calendar6Name
Setting.Description: Defines the name of the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeZone::Calendar6
Setting.Description: Defines the time zone of the indicated calendar, which can be assigned later to a specific queue.

Setting.Name: CalendarWeekDayStart::Calendar6
Setting.Description: Define the start day of the week for the date picker for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar6
Setting.Description: Adds the permanent vacation days for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar6
Setting.Description: Adds the one time vacation days for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar6
Setting.Description: Defines the hours and week days of the indicated calendar, to count the working time.

Setting.Name: TimeZone::Calendar7Name
Setting.Description: Defines the name of the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeZone::Calendar7
Setting.Description: Defines the time zone of the indicated calendar, which can be assigned later to a specific queue.

Setting.Name: CalendarWeekDayStart::Calendar7
Setting.Description: Define the start day of the week for the date picker for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar7
Setting.Description: Adds the permanent vacation days for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar7
Setting.Description: Adds the one time vacation days for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar7
Setting.Description: Defines the hours and week days of the indicated calendar, to count the working time.

Setting.Name: TimeZone::Calendar8Name
Setting.Description: Defines the name of the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeZone::Calendar8
Setting.Description: Defines the time zone of the indicated calendar, which can be assigned later to a specific queue.

Setting.Name: CalendarWeekDayStart::Calendar8
Setting.Description: Define the start day of the week for the date picker for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar8
Setting.Description: Adds the permanent vacation days for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar8
Setting.Description: Adds the one time vacation days for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar8
Setting.Description: Defines the hours and week days of the indicated calendar, to count the working time.

Setting.Name: TimeZone::Calendar9Name
Setting.Description: Defines the name of the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeZone::Calendar9
Setting.Description: Defines the time zone of the indicated calendar, which can be assigned later to a specific queue.

Setting.Name: CalendarWeekDayStart::Calendar9
Setting.Description: Define the start day of the week for the date picker for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar9
Setting.Description: Adds the permanent vacation days for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar9
Setting.Description: Adds the one time vacation days for the indicated calendar.

Setting.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar9
Setting.Description: Defines the hours and week days of the indicated calendar, to count the working time.

Setting.Name: WebMaxFileUpload
Setting.Description: Defines the maximal size (in bytes) for file uploads via the browser. Warning: Setting this option to a value which is too low could cause many masks in your OTRS instance to stop working (probably any mask which takes input from the user).

Setting.Name: WebUploadCacheModule
Setting.Description: Selects the module to handle uploads via the web interface. "DB" stores all uploads in the database, "FS" uses the file system.

Setting.Name: CGILogPrefix
Setting.Description: Specifies the text that should appear in the log file to denote a CGI script entry.

Setting.Name: Frontend::Output::FilterText###AAAURL
Setting.Description: Defines the filter that processes the text in the articles, in order to highlight URLs.

Setting.Name: LostPassword
Setting.Description: Activates lost password feature for agents, in the agent interface.

Setting.Name: ShowMotd
Setting.Description: Shows the message of the day on login screen of the agent interface.

Setting.Name: DemoSystem
Setting.Description: Runs the system in "Demo" mode. If enabled, agents can change preferences, such as selection of language and theme via the agent web interface. These changes are only valid for the current session. It will not be possible for agents to change their passwords.

Setting.Name: OutOfOfficeMessageTemplate
Setting.Description: Defines out of office message template. Two string parameters (%s) available: end date and number of days left.

Value.Item: *** out of office until %s (%s d left) ***

Setting.Name: SwitchToUser
Setting.Description: Allows the administrators to login as other users, via the users administration panel.

Setting.Name: SwitchToCustomer
Setting.Description: Allows the administrators to login as other customers, via the customer user administration panel.

Setting.Name: SwitchToCustomer::PermissionGroup
Setting.Description: Specifies the group where the user needs rw permissions so that he can access the "SwitchToCustomer" feature.

Setting.Name: MIME-Viewer###application/excel
Setting.Description: Specifies the path to the converter that allows the view of Microsoft Excel files, in the web interface.

Setting.Name: MIME-Viewer###application/msword
Setting.Description: Specifies the path to the converter that allows the view of Microsoft Word files, in the web interface.

Setting.Name: MIME-Viewer###application/pdf
Setting.Description: Specifies the path to the converter that allows the view of PDF documents, in the web interface.

Setting.Name: MIME-Viewer###text/xml
Setting.Description: Specifies the path to the converter that allows the view of XML files, in the web interface.

Setting.Name: WebUserAgent::Timeout
Setting.Description: Sets the timeout (in seconds) for http/ftp downloads.

Setting.Name: WebUserAgent::Proxy
Setting.Description: Defines the connections for http/ftp, via a proxy.

Setting.Name: WebUserAgent::DisableSSLVerification
Setting.Description: Turns off SSL certificate validation, for example if you use a transparent HTTPS proxy. Use at your own risk!

Setting.Name: Package::FileUpload
Setting.Description: Enables file upload in the package manager frontend.

Setting.Name: Package::RepositoryRoot
Setting.Description: Defines the location to get online repository list for additional packages. The first available result will be used.

Setting.Name: Package::RepositoryList
Setting.Description: Defines the list of online repositories. Another installations can be used as repository, for example: Key="http://example.com/otrs/public.pl?Action=PublicRepository;File=" and Content="Some Name".

Setting.Name: Package::RepositoryAccessRegExp
Setting.Description: Defines the IP regular expression for accessing the local repository. You need to enable this to have access to your local repository and the package::RepositoryList is required on the remote host.

Setting.Name: Package::Timeout
Setting.Description: Sets the timeout (in seconds) for package downloads. Overwrites "WebUserAgent::Timeout".

Setting.Name: Package::Proxy
Setting.Description: Fetches packages via proxy. Overwrites "WebUserAgent::Proxy".

Setting.Name: Package::AllowLocalModifications
Setting.Description: If this setting is enabled, local modifications will not be highlighted as errors in the package manager and support data collector.

Setting.Name: Package::ShowFeatureAddons
Setting.Description: Toggles display of OTRS FeatureAddons list in PackageManager.

Setting.Name: Package::AllowNotVerifiedPackages
Setting.Description: If this setting is enabled, it is possible to install packages which are not verified by OTRS Group. These packages could threaten your whole system!

Setting.Name: Package::EventModulePost###9000-SupportDataSend
Setting.Description: Package event module file a scheduler task for update registration.

Setting.Name: Events###Package
Setting.Description: List of all Package events to be displayed in the GUI.

Setting.Name: Events###DynamicField
Setting.Description: List of all DynamicField events to be displayed in the GUI.

Setting.Name: Events###LinkObject
Setting.Description: List of all LinkObject events to be displayed in the GUI.

Setting.Name: DynamicFields::ObjectType###CustomerCompany
Setting.Description: DynamicField object registration.

Setting.Name: DynamicFields::ObjectType###CustomerUser
Setting.Description: DynamicField object registration.

Setting.Name: SOAP::User
Setting.Description: Defines the username to access the SOAP handle (bin/cgi-bin/rpc.pl).

Setting.Name: SOAP::Password
Setting.Description: Defines the password to access the SOAP handle (bin/cgi-bin/rpc.pl).

Setting.Name: SOAP::Keep-Alive
Setting.Description: Enable keep-alive connection header for SOAP responses.

Setting.Name: PDF::LogoFile
Setting.Description: Specifies the path of the file for the logo in the page header (gif|jpg|png, 700 x 100 pixel).

Setting.Name: PDF::PageSize
Setting.Description: Defines the standard size of PDF pages.

Setting.Name: PDF::MaxPages
Setting.Description: Defines the maximum number of pages per PDF file.

Setting.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###Proportional
Setting.Description: Defines the path and TTF-File to handle proportional font in PDF documents.

Setting.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###ProportionalBold
Setting.Description: Defines the path and TTF-File to handle bold proportional font in PDF documents.

Setting.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###ProportionalItalic
Setting.Description: Defines the path and TTF-File to handle italic proportional font in PDF documents.

Setting.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###ProportionalBoldItalic
Setting.Description: Defines the path and TTF-File to handle bold italic proportional font in PDF documents.

Setting.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###Monospaced
Setting.Description: Defines the path and TTF-File to handle monospaced font in PDF documents.

Setting.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###MonospacedBold
Setting.Description: Defines the path and TTF-File to handle bold monospaced font in PDF documents.

Setting.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###MonospacedItalic
Setting.Description: Defines the path and TTF-File to handle italic monospaced font in PDF documents.

Setting.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###MonospacedBoldItalic
Setting.Description: Defines the path and TTF-File to handle bold italic monospaced font in PDF documents.

Setting.Name: PGP
Setting.Description: Enables PGP support. When PGP support is enabled for signing and encrypting mail, it is HIGHLY recommended that the web server runs as the OTRS user. Otherwise, there will be problems with the privileges when accessing .gnupg folder.

Setting.Name: PGP::Bin
Setting.Description: Defines the path to PGP binary.

Setting.Name: PGP::Options
Setting.Description: Sets the options for PGP binary.

Setting.Name: PGP::Options::DigestPreference
Setting.Description: Sets the preferred digest to be used for PGP binary.

Setting.Name: PGP::Key::Password
Setting.Description: Sets the password for private PGP key.

Setting.Name: PGP::TrustedNetwork
Setting.Description: Enable this if you trust in all your public and private pgp keys, even if they are not certified with a trusted signature.

Setting.Name: PGP::Log
Setting.Description: Configure your own log text for PGP.

Hash.Item: The PGP signature with the keyid is good.
This key is not certified with a trusted signature!
The PGP signature was made by a revoked key, this could mean that the signature is forged.
The PGP signature was made by a revoked key, this could mean that the signature is forged.
The PGP signature with the keyid has not been verified successfully.
It was not possible to check the PGP signature, this may be caused by a missing public key or an unsupported algorithm.
The PGP signature was made by an expired key.

Setting.Name: PGP::Method
Setting.Description: Sets the method PGP will use to sing and encrypt emails. Note Inline method is not compatible with RichText messages.

Setting.Name: SMIME
Setting.Description: Enables S/MIME support.

Setting.Name: SMIME::Bin
Setting.Description: Defines the path to open ssl binary. It may need a HOME env ($ENV{HOME} = '/var/lib/wwwrun';).

Setting.Name: SMIME::CertPath
Setting.Description: Specifies the directory where SSL certificates are stored.

Setting.Name: SMIME::PrivatePath
Setting.Description: Specifies the directory where private SSL certificates are stored.

Setting.Name: SMIME::CacheTTL
Setting.Description: Cache time in seconds for the SSL certificate attributes.

Setting.Name: SMIME::FetchFromCustomer
Setting.Description: Enables fetch S/MIME from CustomerUser backend support.

Setting.Name: NotificationSenderName
Setting.Description: Specifies the name that should be used by the application when sending notifications. The sender name is used to build the complete display name for the notification master (i.e. "OTRS Notifications" otrs@your.example.com).

Setting.Name: NotificationSenderEmail
Setting.Description: Specifies the email address that should be used by the application when sending notifications. The email address is used to build the complete display name for the notification master (i.e. "OTRS Notifications" otrs@your.example.com). You can use the OTRS_CONFIG_FQDN variable as set in your configuation, or choose another email address.

Setting.Name: NotificationSubjectLostPasswordToken
Setting.Description: Defines the subject for notification mails sent to agents, with token about new requested password.

Setting.Name: NotificationBodyLostPasswordToken
Setting.Description: Defines the body text for notification mails sent to agents, with token about new requested password.

Value.Item:
Hi <OTRS_USERFIRSTNAME>,
You or someone impersonating you has requested to change your OTRS password.
If you want to do this, click on the link below. You will receive another email containing the password.
<OTRS_CONFIG_HttpType>://<OTRS_CONFIG_FQDN>/<OTRS_CONFIG_ScriptAlias>index.pl?Action=LostPassword;Token=<OTRS_TOKEN>
If you did not request a new password, please ignore this email.

Setting.Name: NotificationSubjectLostPassword
Setting.Description: Defines the subject for notification mails sent to agents, about new password.

Setting.Name: NotificationBodyLostPassword
Setting.Description: Defines the body text for notification mails sent to agents, about new password.

Value.Item:
Hi <OTRS_USERFIRSTNAME>,
Here's your new OTRS password.
New password: <OTRS_NEWPW>
You can log in via the following URL:
<OTRS_CONFIG_HttpType>://<OTRS_CONFIG_FQDN>/<OTRS_CONFIG_ScriptAlias>index.pl

Setting.Name: System::Permission
Setting.Description: Standard available permissions for agents within the application. If more permissions are needed, they can be entered here. Permissions must be defined to be effective. Some other good permissions have also been provided built-in: note, close, pending, customer, freetext, move, compose, responsible, forward, and bounce. Make sure that "rw" is always the last registered permission.

Setting.Name: System::Customer::Permission
Setting.Description: Defines the standard permissions available for customers within the application. If more permissions are needed, you can enter them here. Permissions must be hard coded to be effective. Please ensure, when adding any of the afore mentioned permissions, that the "rw" permission remains the last entry.

Setting.Name: ReferenceData::OwnCountryList
Setting.Description: This setting allows you to override the built-in country list with your own list of countries. This is particularly handy if you just want to use a small select group of countries.

Setting.Name: PerformanceLog
Setting.Description: Enables performance log (to log the page response time). It will affect the system performance. Frontend::Module###AdminPerformanceLog must be enabled.

Setting.Name: PerformanceLog::File
Setting.Description: Specifies the path of the file for the performance log.

Setting.Name: PerformanceLog::FileMax
Setting.Description: Defines the maximum size (in MB) of the log file.

Setting.Name: AuthTwoFactorModule
Setting.Description: Defines the two-factor module to authenticate agents.

Setting.Name: AuthTwoFactorModule::SecretPreferencesKey
Setting.Description: Defines the agent preferences key where the shared secret key is stored.

Setting.Name: AuthTwoFactorModule::AllowEmptySecret
Setting.Description: Defines if agents should be allowed to login if they have no shared secret stored in their preferences and therefore are not using two-factor authentication.

Setting.Name: AuthTwoFactorModule::AllowPreviousToken
Setting.Description: Defines if the previously valid token should be accepted for authentication. This is slightly less secure but gives users 30 seconds more time to enter their one-time password.

Setting.Name: PreferencesTable
Setting.Description: Defines the name of the table where the user preferences are stored.

Setting.Name: PreferencesTableKey
Setting.Description: Defines the column to store the keys for the preferences table.

Setting.Name: PreferencesTableValue
Setting.Description: Defines the name of the column to store the data in the preferences table.

Setting.Name: PreferencesTableUserID
Setting.Description: Defines the name of the column to store the user identifier in the preferences table.

Setting.Name: PreferencesGroups###Password
Setting.Description: Defines the config parameters of this item, to be shown in the preferences view. 'PasswordRegExp' allows to match passwords against a regular expression. Define the minimum number of characters using 'PasswordMinSize'. Define if at least 2 lowercase and 2 uppercase letter characters are needed by setting the appropriate option to '1'. 'PasswordMin2Characters' defines if the password needs to contain at least 2 letter characters (set to 0 or 1). 'PasswordNeedDigit' controls the need of at least 1 digit (set to 0 or 1 to control). 'PasswordMaxLoginFailed' allows to set an agent to invalid-temporarily if max failed logins reached. Please note: setting 'Active' to 0 will only prevent agents from editing settings of this group in their personal preferences, but will still allow administrators to edit the settings of another user's behalf. Use 'PreferenceGroup' to control in which area these settings should be shown in the user interface.

Hash.Item: Set a new password by filling in your current password and a new one.

Setting.Name: PreferencesGroups###GoogleAuthenticatorSecretKey
Setting.Description: Defines the config parameters of this item, to be shown in the preferences view. Please note: setting 'Active' to 0 will only prevent agents from editing settings of this group in their personal preferences, but will still allow administrators to edit the settings of another user's behalf. Use 'PreferenceGroup' to control in which area these settings should be shown in the user interface.

Hash.Item: Enter your shared secret to enable two factor authentication. WARNING: Make sure that you add the shared secret to your generator application and the application works well. Otherwise you will be not able to login anymore without the two factor token.
The secret you supplied is invalid. The secret must only contain letters (A-Z, uppercase) and numbers (2-7) and must consist of 16 characters.

Setting.Name: PreferencesGroups###Comment
Setting.Description: Defines the config parameters of this item, to be shown in the preferences view. Please note: setting 'Active' to 0 will only prevent agents from editing settings of this group in their personal preferences, but will still allow administrators to edit the settings of another user's behalf. Use 'PreferenceGroup' to control in which area these settings should be shown in the user interface.

Hash.Item: This is a Description for Comment on Framework.

Setting.Name: PreferencesGroups###DynamicField
Setting.Description: Defines the config parameters of this item, to be shown in the preferences view. Please note: setting 'Active' to 0 will only prevent agents from editing settings of this group in their personal preferences, but will still allow administrators to edit the settings of another user's behalf. Use 'PreferenceGroup' to control in which area these settings should be shown in the user interface.

Hash.Item: This is a Description for DynamicField on Framework.

Setting.Name: PreferencesGroups###Language
Setting.Description: Defines the config parameters of this item, to be shown in the preferences view. Please note: setting 'Active' to 0 will only prevent agents from editing settings of this group in their personal preferences, but will still allow administrators to edit the settings of another user's behalf. Use 'PreferenceGroup' to control in which area these settings should be shown in the user interface.

Setting.Name: PreferencesGroups###Skin
Setting.Description: Defines the config parameters of this item, to be shown in the preferences view. Please note: setting 'Active' to 0 will only prevent agents from editing settings of this group in their personal preferences, but will still allow administrators to edit the settings of another user's behalf. Use 'PreferenceGroup' to control in which area these settings should be shown in the user interface.

Hash.Item: Select your preferred layout for the software.

Setting.Name: PreferencesGroups###Theme
Setting.Description: Defines the config parameters of this item, to be shown in the preferences view. Please note: setting 'Active' to 0 will only prevent agents from editing settings of this group in their personal preferences, but will still allow administrators to edit the settings of another user's behalf. Use 'PreferenceGroup' to control in which area these settings should be shown in the user interface.

Hash.Item: Select your preferred theme for OTRS.

Setting.Name: PreferencesGroups###TimeZone
Setting.Description: Defines the config parameters of this item, to be shown in the preferences view. Please note: setting 'Active' to 0 will only prevent agents from editing settings of this group in their personal preferences, but will still allow administrators to edit the settings of another user's behalf. Use 'PreferenceGroup' to control in which area these settings should be shown in the user interface.

Hash.Item: Select your personal time zone. All times will be displayed relative to this time zone.

Setting.Name: PreferencesGroups###OutOfOffice
Setting.Description: Defines the config parameters of this item, to be shown in the preferences view. Please note: setting 'Active' to 0 will only prevent agents from editing settings of this group in their personal preferences, but will still allow administrators to edit the settings of another user's behalf. Use 'PreferenceGroup' to control in which area these settings should be shown in the user interface.

Hash.Item: If you're going to be out of office, you may wish to let other users know by setting the exact dates of your absence.

Setting.Name: PreferencesGroups###CSVSeparator
Setting.Description: Gives end users the possibility to override the separator character for CSV files, defined in the translation files. Please note: setting 'Active' to 0 will only prevent agents from editing settings of this group in their personal preferences, but will still allow administrators to edit the settings of another user's behalf. Use 'PreferenceGroup' to control in which area these settings should be shown in the user interface.

Hash.Item: Select the separator character used in CSV files (stats and searches). If you don't select a separator here, the default separator for your language will be used.

Setting.Name: PreferencesGroups###Avatar
Setting.Description: Defines the users avatar. Please note: setting 'Active' to 0 will only prevent agents from editing settings of this group in their personal preferences, but will still allow administrators to edit the settings of another user's behalf. Use 'PreferenceGroup' to control in which area these settings should be shown in the user interface.

Setting.Name: CustomerPanelUserID
Setting.Description: Defines the user identifier for the customer panel.

Setting.Name: CustomerGroupSupport
Setting.Description: Activates support for customer and customer user groups.

Setting.Name: CustomerGroupAlwaysGroups
Setting.Description: Defines the groups every customer user will be in (if CustomerGroupSupport is enabled and you don't want to manage every customer user for these groups).

Setting.Name: CustomerGroupCompanyAlwaysGroups
Setting.Description: Defines the groups every customer will be in (if CustomerGroupSupport is enabled and you don't want to manage every customer for these groups).

Setting.Name: CustomerGroupPermissionContext###001-CustomerID-same
Setting.Description: Defines a permission context for customer to group assignment.

Hash.Item: Gives customer users group based access to tickets from customer users of the same customer (ticket CustomerID is a CustomerID of the customer user).

Setting.Name: CustomerGroupPermissionContext###100-CustomerID-other
Setting.Description: Defines a permission context for customer to group assignment.

Hash.Item: Provides customer users access to tickets even if the tickets are not assigned to a customer user of the same customer ID(s), based on permission groups.

Setting.Name: CustomerFrontend::HeaderMetaModule###1-Refresh
Setting.Description: Defines the module to generate code for periodic page reloads.

Setting.Name: CustomerFrontend::NotifyModule###1-ShowAgentOnline
Setting.Description: Defines the module that shows the currently logged in agents in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: CustomerFrontend::NotifyModule###1-ShowCustomerOnline
Setting.Description: Defines the module that shows the currently logged in customers in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: CustomerFrontend::NotifyModule###6-CustomerSystemMaintenance-Check
Setting.Description: Defines the module to display a notification in the customer interface, if the customer is logged in while having system maintenance active.

Setting.Name: CustomerFrontend::NotifyModule###7-CustomerUserTimeZone-Check
Setting.Description: Defines the module to display a notification in the customer interface, if the customer user has not yet selected a time zone.

Setting.Name: CustomerPanelLoginURL
Setting.Description: Defines an alternate login URL for the customer panel..

Setting.Name: CustomerPanelLogoutURL
Setting.Description: Defines an alternate logout URL for the customer panel.

Setting.Name: Frontend::CustomerUser::Item###1-GoogleMaps
Setting.Description: Defines a customer item, which generates a google maps icon at the end of a customer info block.

Setting.Name: Frontend::CustomerUser::Item###2-Google
Setting.Description: Defines a customer item, which generates a google icon at the end of a customer info block.

Setting.Name: Frontend::CustomerUser::Item###2-LinkedIn
Setting.Description: Defines a customer item, which generates a LinkedIn icon at the end of a customer info block.

Setting.Name: Frontend::CustomerUser::Item###3-XING
Setting.Description: Defines a customer item, which generates a XING icon at the end of a customer info block.

Setting.Name: CustomerPanelPreApplicationModule###CustomerAccept
Setting.Description: This module and its PreRun() function will be executed, if defined, for every request. This module is useful to check some user options or to display news about new applications.

Setting.Name: CustomerPanel::InfoKey
Setting.Description: Defines the key to check with CustomerAccept. If this user preferences key is true, then the message is accepted by the system.

Setting.Name: CustomerPanel::InfoFile
Setting.Description: Defines the path of the shown info file, that is located under Kernel/Output/HTML/Templates/Standard/CustomerAccept.tt.

Setting.Name: CustomerPanelLostPassword
Setting.Description: Activates lost password feature for customers.

Setting.Name: CustomerPanelCreateAccount
Setting.Description: Enables customers to create their own accounts.

Setting.Name: CustomerPanelCreateAccount::MailRestrictions::Whitelist
Setting.Description: If active, one of the regular expressions has to match the user's email address to allow registration.

Setting.Name: CustomerPanelCreateAccount::MailRestrictions::Blacklist
Setting.Description: If active, none of the regular expressions may match the user's email address to allow registration.

Setting.Name: CustomerPanelSubjectLostPasswordToken
Setting.Description: Defines the subject for notification mails sent to customers, with token about new requested password.

Setting.Name: CustomerPanelBodyLostPasswordToken
Setting.Description: Defines the body text for notification mails sent to customers, with token about new requested password.

Value.Item:
Hi <OTRS_USERFIRSTNAME>,
You or someone impersonating you has requested to change your OTRS password.
If you want to do this, click on this link. You will receive another email containing the password.
<OTRS_CONFIG_HttpType>://<OTRS_CONFIG_FQDN>/<OTRS_CONFIG_ScriptAlias>customer.pl?Action=CustomerLostPassword;Token=<OTRS_TOKEN>
If you did not request a new password, please ignore this email.

Setting.Name: CustomerPanelSubjectLostPassword
Setting.Description: Defines the subject for notification mails sent to customers, about new password.

Setting.Name: CustomerPanelBodyLostPassword
Setting.Description: Defines the body text for notification mails sent to customers, about new password.

Setting.Name: CustomerPanelSubjectNewAccount
Setting.Description: Defines the subject for notification mails sent to customers, about new account.

Setting.Name: CustomerPanelBodyNewAccount
Setting.Description: Defines the body text for notification mails sent to customers, about new account.

Value.Item:
Hi <OTRS_USERFIRSTNAME>,
You or someone impersonating you has created a new OTRS account for you.
Full name: <OTRS_USERFIRSTNAME> <OTRS_USERLASTNAME> User name: <OTRS_USERLOGIN> Password : <OTRS_USERPASSWORD>
You can log in via the following URL. We encourage you to change your password via the Preferences button after logging in.
<OTRS_CONFIG_HttpType>://<OTRS_CONFIG_FQDN>/<OTRS_CONFIG_ScriptAlias>customer.pl

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule
Setting.Description: Defines the module to authenticate customers.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::CryptType
Setting.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, the encryption type of passwords must be specified.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::bcryptCost
Setting.Description: If "bcrypt" was selected for CryptType, use cost specified here for bcrypt hashing. Currently max. supported cost value is 31.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::Table
Setting.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, the name of the table where your customer data should be stored must be specified.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::CustomerKey
Setting.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, the name of the column for the CustomerKey in the customer table must be specified.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::CustomerPassword
Setting.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, the column name for the CustomerPassword in the customer table must be specified.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::DSN
Setting.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, the DSN for the connection to the customer table must be specified.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::User
Setting.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, a username to connect to the customer table can be specified.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::Password
Setting.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, a password to connect to the customer table can be specified.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::Type
Setting.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, a database driver (normally autodetection is used) can be specified.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::HTTPBasicAuth::Replace
Setting.Description: If "HTTPBasicAuth" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you can specify to strip leading parts of user names (e. g. for domains like example_domain\user to user).

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::HTTPBasicAuth::ReplaceRegExp
Setting.Description: If "HTTPBasicAuth" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you can specify (by using a RegExp) to strip parts of REMOTE_USER (e. g. for to remove trailing domains). RegExp-Note, $1 will be the new Login.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::Host
Setting.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, the LDAP host can be specified.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::BaseDN
Setting.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, the BaseDN must be specified.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::UID
Setting.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, the user identifier must be specified.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::GroupDN
Setting.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::Authmodule, you can check if the user is allowed to authenticate because he is in a posixGroup, e.g. user needs to be in a group xyz to use OTRS. Specify the group, who may access the system.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::AccessAttr
Setting.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you can specify access attributes here.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::UserAttr
Setting.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, user attributes can be specified. For LDAP posixGroups use UID, for non LDAP posixGroups use full user DN.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::SearchUserDN
Setting.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule and your users have only anonymous access to the LDAP tree, but you want to search through the data, you can do this with a user who has access to the LDAP directory. Specify the username for this special user here.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::SearchUserPw
Setting.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule and your users have only anonymous access to the LDAP tree, but you want to search through the data, you can do this with a user who has access to the LDAP directory. Specify the password for this special user here.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::AlwaysFilter
Setting.Description: If "LDAP" was selected, you can add a filter to each LDAP query, e.g. (mail=*), (objectclass=user) or (!objectclass=computer).

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::UserSuffix
Setting.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule and if you want to add a suffix to every customer login name, specifiy it here, e. g. you just want to write the username user but in your LDAP directory exists user@domain.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::Params
Setting.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule and special paramaters are needed for the Net::LDAP perl module, you can specify them here. See "perldoc Net::LDAP" for more information about the parameters.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::Die
Setting.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you can specify if the applications will stop if e. g. a connection to a server can't be established due to network problems.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::Radius::Host
Setting.Description: If "Radius" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, the radius host must be specified.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::Radius::Password
Setting.Description: If "Radius" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, the password to authenticate to the radius host must be specified.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthModule::Radius::Die
Setting.Description: If "Radius" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you can specify if the applications will stop if e. g. a connection to a server can't be established due to network problems.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthTwoFactorModule
Setting.Description: Defines the two-factor module to authenticate customers.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthTwoFactorModule::SecretPreferencesKey
Setting.Description: Defines the customer preferences key where the shared secret key is stored.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthTwoFactorModule::AllowEmptySecret
Setting.Description: Defines if customers should be allowed to login if they have no shared secret stored in their preferences and therefore are not using two-factor authentication.

Setting.Name: Customer::AuthTwoFactorModule::AllowPreviousToken
Setting.Description: Defines if the previously valid token should be accepted for authentication. This is slightly less secure but gives users 30 seconds more time to enter their one-time password.

Setting.Name: CustomerPreferences
Setting.Description: Defines the parameters for the customer preferences table.

Setting.Name: CustomerPreferencesGroups###Password
Setting.Description: Defines all the parameters for this item in the customer preferences. 'PasswordRegExp' allows to match passwords against a regular expression. Define the minimum number of characters using 'PasswordMinSize'. Define if at least 2 lowercase and 2 uppercase letter characters are needed by setting the appropriate option to '1'. 'PasswordMin2Characters' defines if the password needs to contain at least 2 letter characters (set to 0 or 1). 'PasswordNeedDigit' controls the need of at least 1 digit (set to 0 or 1 to control).

Hash.Item: Set a new password by filling in your current password and a new one.

Setting.Name: CustomerPreferencesGroups###GoogleAuthenticatorSecretKey
Setting.Description: Defines the config parameters of this item, to be shown in the preferences view.

Hash.Item: Enter your shared secret to enable two factor authentication. WARNING: Make sure that you add the shared secret to your generator application and the application works well. Otherwise you will be not able to login anymore without the two factor token.
The secret you supplied is invalid. The secret must only contain letters (A-Z, uppercase) and numbers (2-7) and must consist of 16 characters.

Setting.Name: CustomerPreferencesGroups###Language
Setting.Description: Defines all the parameters for this item in the customer preferences.

Setting.Name: CustomerPreferencesGroups###TimeZone
Setting.Description: Defines all the parameters for this item in the customer preferences.

Hash.Item: Select your personal time zone. All times will be displayed relative to this time zone.

Setting.Name: CustomerPreferencesGroups###Theme
Setting.Description: Defines all the parameters for this item in the customer preferences.

Hash.Item: Select your preferred theme for OTRS.

Setting.Name: CustomerPreferencesGroups###PGP
Setting.Description: Defines all the parameters for this item in the customer preferences.

Setting.Name: CustomerPreferencesGroups###SMIME
Setting.Description: Defines all the parameters for this item in the customer preferences.

Setting.Name: PreferencesGroups###CommunicationLogPageShown
Setting.Description: Parameters for the pages (in which the communication log entries are shown) of the communication log overview.

Hash.Item: Communication log limit per page for Communication Log Overview.

Setting.Description: Allows agents to generate individual-related stats.

Setting.Description: Allows invalid agents to generate individual-related stats.

"Mandatory" determines if the plugin is always shown and can not be removed by agents.

Setting.Name: Frontend::Output::FilterText###OutputFilterTextAutoLink
Setting.Description: Defines a filter to process the text in the articles, in order to highlight predefined keywords.

Setting.Name: Frontend::Output::OutputFilterTextAutoLink###CVE
Setting.Description: Defines a filter for html output to add links behind CVE numbers. The element Image allows two input kinds. At once the name of an image (e.g. faq.png). In this case the OTRS image path will be used. The second possiblity is to insert the link to the image.

Setting.Name: Frontend::Output::OutputFilterTextAutoLink###Bugtraq
Setting.Description: Defines a filter for html output to add links behind bugtraq numbers. The element Image allows two input kinds. At once the name of an image (e.g. faq.png). In this case the OTRS image path will be used. The second possiblity is to insert the link to the image.

Setting.Name: Frontend::Output::OutputFilterTextAutoLink###MSBulletins
Setting.Description: Defines a filter for html output to add links behind MSBulletin numbers. The element Image allows two input kinds. At once the name of an image (e.g. faq.png). In this case the OTRS image path will be used. The second possiblity is to insert the link to the image.

Setting.Name: Frontend::Output::OutputFilterTextAutoLink###Setting1
Setting.Description: Define a filter for html output to add links behind a defined string. The element Image allows two input kinds. At once the name of an image (e.g. faq.png). In this case the OTRS image path will be used. The second possiblity is to insert the link to the image.

Setting.Name: Frontend::Output::OutputFilterTextAutoLink###Setting2
Setting.Description: Defines a filter for html output to add links behind a defined string. The element Image allows two input kinds. At once the name of an image (e.g. faq.png). In this case the OTRS image path will be used. The second possiblity is to insert the link to the image.

Setting.Name: Secure::DisableBanner
Setting.Description: If enabled, the OTRS version tag will be removed from the Webinterface, the HTTP headers and the X-Headers of outgoing mails. NOTE: If you change this option, please make sure to delete the cache.

Hash.Item: This is the default orange - black skin.

Setting.Name: Loader::Agent::Skin###001-slim
Setting.Description: Default skin for the agent interface (slim version).

Hash.Item: "Slim" skin which tries to save screen space for power users.

Setting.Name: Loader::Agent::Skin###001-ivory
Setting.Description: Balanced white skin by Felix Niklas.

Hash.Item: Balanced white skin by Felix Niklas.

Setting.Name: Loader::Agent::Skin###001-ivory-slim
Setting.Description: Balanced white skin by Felix Niklas (slim version).

Setting.Description: High contrast skin for visually impaired users.

Hash.Item: High contrast skin for visually impaired users.

Setting.Name: Loader::Agent::DefaultSelectedSkin
Setting.Description: The agent skin's InternalName which should be used in the agent interface. Please check the available skins in Frontend::Agent::Skins.

Setting.Name: Loader::Agent::DefaultSelectedSkin::HostBased
Setting.Description: It is possible to configure different skins, for example to distinguish between diferent agents, to be used on a per-domain basis within the application. Using a regular expression (regex), you can configure a Key/Content pair to match a domain. The value in "Key" should match the domain, and the value in "Content" should be a valid skin on your system. Please see the example entries for the proper form of the regex.

Setting.Name: Loader::Customer::Skin###000-default
Setting.Description: Default skin for the customer interface.

Hash.Item: This is the default orange - black skin for the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Loader::Customer::SelectedSkin
Setting.Description: The customer skin's InternalName which should be used in the customer interface. Please check the available skins in Frontend::Customer::Skins.

Setting.Name: Loader::Customer::SelectedSkin::HostBased
Setting.Description: It is possible to configure different skins, for example to distinguish between diferent customers, to be used on a per-domain basis within the application. Using a regular expression (regex), you can configure a Key/Content pair to match a domain. The value in "Key" should match the domain, and the value in "Content" should be a valid skin on your system. Please see the example entries for the proper form of the regex.

Setting.Name: SystemMaintenance::IsActiveDefaultLoginMessage
Setting.Description: Sets the default message for the login screen on Agent and Customer interface, it's shown when a running system maintenance period is active.

Value.Item: We are performing scheduled maintenance. We should be back online shortly.

Setting.Name: SystemMaintenance::IsActiveDefaultLoginErrorMessage
Setting.Description: Sets the default error message for the login screen on Agent and Customer interface, it's shown when a running system maintenance period is active.

Value.Item: We are performing scheduled maintenance. Login is temporarily not available.
